Group Financial Controller

Company Name [axr] Recruitment & Search Company Location Sydney, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 15 hours ago Number of views 40 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Financial control and management accounting
  • Leading digital consulting business
  • Circa $200,000 package plus bonus


ABOUT THE COMPANY
\xa0\xa0
This organisation operates in the digital consulting space and is recognised as an industry leader due to their high-quality products and level of service. They have expanded rapidly over recent years which has placed greater importance on financial information to help support commercial decision making.
\xa0
ABOUT THE ROLE\xa0
Reporting to the CFO, you will be in a position of driving change across monthly reporting, compliance and process improvement. First step will be to establish monthly data integrity through agreed processes, strong system controls and process discipline. You will build on this with strong forecasting and working in a number of ad hoc 'finance related' projects including integrating “end to end” processes and procedures. You will also make sound technical and value add recommendations to the business helping to improve the financial position, through identifying areas of risk and opportunity.
\xa0
DUTIES

  • Manage the preparation and presentation of financial statements, reports, ad hoc special analysis for Management and/or Board use
  • Co-ordinate the annual budgeting process and ensure that the budgets are appropriately uploaded and reported against.
  • Deliver month end and year end close processes
  • Ensure that the following Models are appropriately maintained:
    • Balance Sheet Forecast
    • Cashflow Forecast
  • Manage a team of 4
  • Ensure all audit files are prepared in accordance with the audit timetable
\xa0
SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
  • Demonstrated financial and management accounting experience
  • Experience managing and developing a team
  • Qualified CA, CPA or CFA
  • Experience within Big 4 or large mid-tier accounting firm highly regarded
\xa0
BENEFITS
  • Great corporate culture
  • High level of exposure to highly regarded executive team
  • Exposure to senior stakeholders


If this sounds like the role for you please apply through the link or contact Fraser Chapman on fraserc@axr.com.au

865346613:
[

Postdoctoral Fellowship in Experimental Molecular Microbiology

Company Name CSIRO Company Location Canberra, Australian Capital Territory, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 84 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Are you a recent (or soon-to-be) PhD graduate in the areas of plant or fungal molecular biology and microbiology?
  • Work with CSIRO's National Collections and Marine Infrastructure business unit
  • Kick-start your research career at Australia's premier research organisation


The Position

Postdoctoral Fellows are appointed for up to three years and will work closely with a leading Research Scientist or Engineer in their respective field. They carry out innovative, impactful research of strategic importance to CSIRO with the possibility of novel and important scientific outcomes. They present the findings in appropriate publications and at conferences.


Future Science Platforms are an investment in science that underpins innovation and that has the potential to help reinvent and create new industries for Australia. To position Australia to build a vibrant synthetic biology research and development community to support the bio-based industries and ecoengineering activities of tomorrow, CSIRO has established the Synthetic Biology FSP (SynBioFSP). Synthetic Biology (SynBio) is the design and construction of biological parts, devices, and organisms (usually based on DNA-encoded componentry); and their application for useful purposes.


As a postdoctoral fellow on our team, you will be a part of a project of which the overall objective is to build a platform for reliable resynthesis of a lichen symbiosis by focusing on two aims:

  • Creating novel devices to manipulate interactions among symbionts and lichen-colonising microbes;
  • Using ‘omic approaches to characterise key features of lichen development.

This role will focus on both aims and will work in conjunction with experts on lichen biology, ‘omics, device design and fabrication, and network modelling to achieve them.


Your duties will include:

  • Documenting cellular changes in the fungal and algal partners during lichen development, using various microscopy techniques, and by collecting liquid and/or cellular samples to generate genomic, proteomic, transcriptomic, lipidomic and metabolomic data.
  • Performing quality control and assembly of high throughput sequencing data, as well as the annotation of reference genomes for the fungal and algal study species.
  • Engaging with external collaborators and the Australian nanotechnology community to develop expertise in the design and fabrication of micro- and mesoscale devices that will be used to manipulate interactions between the fungal and algal partners during lichen development.
  • Liaising with internal and external collaborators to collate the omics data and analyse these data with the help of a systems biology modeller who is part of the project team.


Location: \xa0Canberra (Black Mountain), ACT, Australia
Salary: \xa0AU$82K to AU$93K plus up to 15.4% superannuation
Tenure: \xa0Specified term of 2 years and 6 months
Job reference:\xa0 58555


To be successful, you will need:

  • A doctorate (or will shortly satisfy the requirements of a PhD) in a relevant discipline area, such as plant or fungal molecular biology and microbiology.
  • The ability to independently design, plan, and implement multiple culture experiments involving micro-organisms in a time-efficient manner.
  • Experience with using micro-organisms (preferably fungi or microalgae) in research experiments, including working in sterile conditions, isolating/manipulating single cells, and co-culturing micro-organisms.
  • Technical capability in plant and/or fungal molecular biology, including DNA or RNA extractions, high throughput sequencing, and genome assembly.
  • The ability to work effectively as part of a multi-disciplinary, regionally dispersed research team, plus the motivation and discipline to carry out autonomous research.
  • A record of science innovation and creativity, plus the ability & willingness to incorporate novel ideas and approaches into scientific investigations.


Before you apply, please view the full position details and selection criteria here:\xa0

https://jobs.csiro.au/job/Canberra%2C-ACT-Postdoctoral-Fellowship-in-Experimental-Molecular-Microbiology/503388000/

We work flexibly at CSIRO, offering a range of options for how, when and where you work. Talk to us about how this role could be flexible for you.


We imagine. We collaborate. We innovate.\xa0At CSIRO, we do the extraordinary every day. We innovate for tomorrow and help improve today – for our customers, all Australians and the world. We do this by using science and technology to solve real issues. Diversity is the compass that navigates our innovation. We provide an inclusive workplace that respects, values and actively pursues the benefits of a diverse workforce.


How to apply:\xa0Please upload one document only containing both your CV/Resume and cover letter, ensuring you provide enough information relevant to the essential and desirable criteria as listed in the position description, to enable the selection panel to determine your suitability.


Applications close:\xa011:59pm AEST, Tuesday 9th October 2018


Please note: This is a re-advertisement of job reference no. 57011. Previous applicants need not apply.

Job description

Sales Specialist - Moorabbin
Moorabbin VIC, Australia
  • Permanent role with Australia's premier trade and tool retailer
  • Extensive product training provided to fast track you to success
  • Friendly and welcoming team
About the Role

Total Tools Moorabbin is currently hunting for multiple expert Retail Sales Specialists who have a real passion for tools & trades. This is an opportunity to utilise your current skills and experience within a store that focuses on your growth and development.

You will be dedicated to working and growing in our industry and willing to learn or expand your skills in sales and customer service.

If successful, you will provide high-quality customer service and contribute to a sales culture in a retail store. You will ensure customer satisfaction through your exemplary product knowledge, customer service and ability to offer solutions.

Our customers are professionals who make a living using quality tools. When it comes to tools they look to us for professional advice, service and solutions.

Immediate start.

You Will Be Responsible For
  • Processing sales transactions
  • Providing advice and information on products
  • Handling customer queries and offering solutions
  • Maintaining store displays

Does This Sound Like You
  • Sales and/or retail experience
  • Dedication to providing exceptional customer service
  • Confirmed ability to achieve and exceed sales targets
  • Has worked with and understands tools
  • Passionate, highly motivated, and a phenomenal teammate
  • Computer literacy
Our Location:

Shop 7/430 Warrigal Road Moorabbin 3202

Who We Are

Total Tools is over 25 years old and has a strong support team which is a large part of our success. The company has over 70 franchised outlets & employs hundreds of people nationally. As a company we are considered the premier supplier of tools to trade & industry in Australia.

Our customers are professionals who make a living using quality tools. When it comes to tools they look to us for professional advice, service and solutions.

If you want to join the Total Tools team, apply today.

Job description

Are you looking for a challenging and diverse communications role that will make a real difference to children and adults with a devastating disease?


Help shape the future of a burgeoning charity and play your part in changing lives!


The role is a busy, hands-on position supporting our small team of staff and dedicated volunteers to deliver the Foundation’s initiatives and have a real impact on the lives of those affected.


Responsibilities include:

  • Conduct communications campaigns to support the patient services, medical research, education and fundraising goals and objectives outlined in the Foundation’s 5 year strategic plan. Provide communications support for events including:
  • Day to day coordination of our CRM database (Salesforce)
  • Writing and creating eDMs using our email marketing platform (Constant Contact)
  • Ongoing content management for the website and sub-brand websites
  • Drive the social media presence its sub-brands
  • Maintain and expand communication collateral
  • Provide assistance and stewardship for supporters and volunteers

Working in a small team in a diverse role with massive potential, the successful candidate must have:

  • Relevant experience in a similar industry or role (health promotion charity preferred) and/or outstanding tertiary qualifications
  • Exemplary written and verbal communication skills
  • The passion to get behind our important cause and make a difference
  • Outstanding organisational skills
  • The ability to work both independently and cohesively as part of a small and passionate team
  • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • A flexible and friendly nature
